other_tests.findings: Overall density and appearance of myelinated fibers were normal. A few perineurial blood vessels had focal perivascular mononuclear-cell infiltrates.
other_tests.changes_over_time: 11 months later, the axonal morphology was again abnormal with a 61% reduction in axonal density.

other_tests.findings: Scattered perivascular mononuclear infiltrates were present. There was no evidence of amyloid. Axonal swellings were observed, consistent with early degeneration.
other_tests.changes_over_time: 11 months later, showed marked reduction in neurite density and axonal swelling.

other_tests.date: One year before evaluation at hospital
Four months before evaluation at hospital
